 2526: 
 2527: t_map_encode_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2528:     <<131,116,0,0,0,0>> = erlang:term_to_binary(#{}),
 2529:     Pairs = [
 2530: 	{a,b},{"key","values"},{<<"key">>,<<"value">>},
 2531: 	{1,b},{[atom,1],{<<"wat">>,1,2,3}},
 2532: 	{aa,"values"},
 2533: 	{1 bsl 64 + (1 bsl 50 - 1), sc1},
 2534: 	{99, sc2},
 2535: 	{1 bsl 65 + (1 bsl 51 - 1), sc3},
 2536: 	{88, sc4},
 2537: 	{1 bsl 66 + (1 bsl 52 - 1), sc5},
 2538: 	{77, sc6},
 2539: 	{1 bsl 67 + (1 bsl 53 - 1), sc3},
 2540: 	{75, sc6}, {-10,sc8},
 2541: 	{<<>>, sc9}, {3.14158, sc10},
 2542: 	{[3.14158], sc11}, {more_atoms, sc12},
 2543: 	{{more_tuples}, sc13}, {self(), sc14},
 2544: 	{{},{}},{[],[]},
 2545:         {map_s, #{a=>a, 2=>b, 3=>c}},
 2546:         {map_l, maps:from_list([{I,I}||I <- lists:seq(1,74)])}
 2547:     ],
 2548:     ok = map_encode_decode_and_match(Pairs,[],#{}),
 2549: 
 2550:     %% check sorting
 2551: 
 2552:     %% literally #{ b=>2, a=>1 } in the internal order
 2553:     #{ a:=1, b:=2 } =
 2554: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,2,100,0,1,98,97,2,100,0,1,97,97,1>>),
 2555: 
 2556: 
 2557:     %% literally #{ "hi" => "value", a=>33, b=>55 } in the internal order
 2558:     #{ a:=33, b:=55, "hi" := "value"} = erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,3,
 2559: 	107,0,2,104,105,            % "hi" :: list()
 2560: 	107,0,5,118,97,108,117,101, % "value" :: list()
 2561: 	100,0,1,97,                 % a :: atom()
 2562: 	97,33,                      % 33 :: integer()
 2563: 	100,0,1,98,                 % b :: atom()
 2564: 	97,55                       % 55 :: integer()
 2565: 	>>),
 2566: 
 2567:     %% Maps of different sizes
 2568:     lists:foldl(fun(Key, M0) ->
 2569: 			M1 = M0#{Key => Key},
 2570: 			case Key rem 17 of
 2571: 			    0 ->
 2572: 				M1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M1)),
 2573:                                 M1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M1, [deterministic]));
 2574: 			    _ ->
 2575: 				ok
 2576: 			end,
 2577: 			M1
 2578: 		end,
 2579: 		#{},
 2580: 		lists:seq(1,10000)),
 2581: 
 2582:     %% many maps in same binary
 2583:     MapList = lists:foldl(fun(K, [M|_]=Acc) -> [M#{K => K} | Acc] end,
 2584: 			  [#{}],
 2585: 			  lists:seq(1,100)),
 2586:     MapList = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MapList)),
 2587:     MapListR = lists:reverse(MapList),
 2588:     MapListR = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MapListR)),
 2589: 
 2590:     %% error cases
 2591:     %% template: <<131,116,0,0,0,2,100,0,1,97,100,0,1,98,97,1,97,1>>
 2592:     %% which is: #{ a=>1, b=>1 }
 2593: 
 2594:     %% uniqueness violation
 2595:     %% literally #{ a=>1, "hi"=>"value", a=>2 }
 2596:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{_,_,_,_}|_]}} = (catch
 2597: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,3,
 2598: 			       100,0,1,97,
 2599: 			       97,1,
 2600: 			       107,0,2,104,105,
 2601: 			       107,0,5,118,97,108,117,101,
 2602: 			       100,0,1,97,
 2603: 			       97,2>>)),
 2604: 
 2605:     %% bad size (too large)
 2606:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{_,_,_,_}|_]}} = (catch
 2607: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,12,100,0,1,97,97,1,100,0,1,98,97,1>>)),
 2608: 
 2609:     %% bad size (too small) .. should fail just truncate it .. weird.
 2610:     %% possibly change external format so truncated will be #{a:=1}
 2611:     #{ a:=b } = erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,1,100,0,1,97,100,0,1,98,97,1,97,1>>),
 2612: 
 2613:     %% specific fannerl (opensource app) binary_to_term error in 18.1
 2614: 
 2615:     #{bias := {1,1,0},
 2616:       bit_fail := 0,
 2617:       connections := #{{2,9}   := _,
 2618:                        {8,14}  := _,
 2619:                        {2,12}  := _,
 2620:                        {5,7}   := _,
 2621:                        {11,16} := _,
 2622:                        {11,15} := _},
 2623:       layers := {5,7,3},
 2624:       network_type := fann_nettype_layer,
 2625:       num_input := 5,
 2626:       num_layers := 3,
 2627:       num_output := 3,
 2628:       rprop_delta_max := _,
 2629:       rprop_delta_min := _,
 2630:       total_connections := 66,
 2631:       total_neurons := 17,
 2632:       train_error_function := fann_errorfunc_tanh,
 2633:       train_stop_function := fann_stopfunc_mse,
 2634:       training_algorithm := fann_train_rprop} = erlang:binary_to_term(fannerl()),
 2635:     ok.
 2636: 
 2637: map_encode_decode_and_match([{K,V}|Pairs], EncodedPairs, M0) ->
 2638:     M1 = maps:put(K,V,M0),
 2639:     B0 = erlang:term_to_binary(M1),
 2640:     Ls = [{erlang:term_to_binary(K), erlang:term_to_binary(V)}|EncodedPairs],
 2641:     ok = match_encoded_map(B0, length(Ls), Ls),
 2642:     %% decode and match it
 2643:     M1 = erlang:binary_to_term(B0),
 2644:     map_encode_decode_and_match(Pairs,Ls,M1);
 2645: map_encode_decode_and_match([],_,_) -> ok.
 2646: 
 2647: match_encoded_map(<<131,116,Size:32,Encoded/binary>>,Size,Items) ->
 2648:     match_encoded_map_stripped_size(Encoded,Items,Items);
 2649: match_encoded_map(_,_,_) -> no_match_size.
 2650: 
 2651: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(<<>>,_,_) -> ok;
 2652: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B0,[{<<131,K/binary>>,<<131,V/binary>>}|Items],Ls) ->
 2653:     Ksz = byte_size(K),
 2654:     Vsz = byte_size(V),
 2655:     case B0 of
 2656: 	<<K:Ksz/binary,V:Vsz/binary,B1/binary>> ->
 2657: 	    match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B1,Ls,Ls);
 2658: 	_ ->
 2659: 	    match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B0,Items,Ls)
 2660:     end;
 2661: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(_,[],_) -> fail.
 2662: 
 2663: 
 2664: t_bif_map_to_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2665:     [] = maps:to_list(#{}),
 2666:     [{a,1},{b,2}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{a=>1,b=>2})),
 2667:     [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{c=>3,a=>1,b=>2})),
 2668:     [{a,1},{b,2},{g,3}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{g=>3,a=>1,b=>2})),
 2669:     [{a,1},{b,2},{g,3},{"c",4}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{g=>3,a=>1,b=>2,"c"=>4})),
 2670:     [{3,v2},{hi,v4},{{hi,3},v5},{"hi",v3},{<<"hi">>,v1}] =
 2671: 	lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{<<"hi">>=>v1,3=>v2,"hi"=>v3,hi=>v4,{hi,3}=>v5})),
 2672: 
 2673:     [{3,v7},{hi,v9},{{hi,3},v10},{"hi",v8},{<<"hi">>,v6}] =
 2674: 	lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{<<"hi">>=>v1,3=>v2,"hi"=>v3,hi=>v4,{hi,3}=>v5,
 2675: 				  <<"hi">>=>v6,3=>v7,"hi"=>v8,hi=>v9,{hi,3}=>v10})),
 2676: 
 2677:     %% error cases
 2678:     do_badmap(fun(T) ->
 2679: 		      {'EXIT', {{badmap,T},_}} =
 2680: 			  (catch maps:to_list(T))
 2681: 	      end),
 2682:     ok.
 2683: 
 2684: 
 2685: t_bif_map_from_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2686:     #{} = maps:from_list([]),
 2687:     A   = maps:from_list([]),
 2688:     0   = erlang:map_size(A),
 2689: 
 2690:     #{a:=1,b:=2}      = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2}]),
 2691:     #{c:=3,a:=1,b:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}]),
 2692:     #{g:=3,a:=1,b:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2},{g,3}]),
 2693: 
 2694:     #{a:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{a,3},{a,2}]),
 2695: 
 2696:     #{ <<"hi">>:=v1,3:=v3,"hi":=v6,hi:=v4,{hi,3}:=v5} =
 2697: 	maps:from_list([{3,v3},{"hi",v6},{hi,v4},{{hi,3},v5},{<<"hi">>,v1}]),
 2698: 
 2699:     #{<<"hi">>:=v6,3:=v8,"hi":=v11,hi:=v9,{hi,3}:=v10} =
 2700: 	maps:from_list([ {{hi,3},v3}, {"hi",v0},{3,v1}, {<<"hi">>,v4}, {hi,v2},
 2701: 	    {<<"hi">>,v6}, {{hi,3},v10},{"hi",v11}, {hi,v9}, {3,v8}]),
 2702: 
 2703:     %% repeated keys (large -> small)
 2704:     Ps1 = [{a,I}|| I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2705:     Ps2 = [{a,I}|| I <- lists:seq(33,64)],
 2706: 
 2707:     M = maps:from_list(Ps1 ++ [{b,1},{c,1}] ++ Ps2),
 2708:     #{ a := 64, b := 1, c := 1 } = M,
 2709: 
 2710:     %% error cases
 2711:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},b]))),
 2712:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},{b,b,3}]))),
 2713:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},<<>>]))),
 2714:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b}|{b,a}]))),
 2715:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id(a))),
 2716:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id(42))),
 2717:     ok.
 2718: 
 2719: t_bif_map_next(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2720: 
 2721:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 2722: 
 2723:     try
 2724: 
 2725:         none = maps:next(maps:iterator(id(#{}))),
 2726: 
 2727:         verify_iterator(#{}),
 2728:         verify_iterator(#{a => 1, b => 2, c => 3}),
 2729: 
 2730:         %% Use fatmap in order to test iterating in very deep maps
 2731:         FM = fatmap(43),
 2732:         verify_iterator(FM),
 2733: 
 2734:         {'EXIT', {{badmap,[{a,b},b]},_}} = (catch maps:iterator(id([{a,b},b]))),
 2735:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id(a))),
 2736:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([a|FM]))),
 2737:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([1|#{}]))),
 2738:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-1|#{}]))),
 2739:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-1|FM]))),
 2740:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF|FM]))),
 2741:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF|FM]))),
 2742: 
 2743:         %% This us a whitebox test that the error code works correctly.
 2744:         %% It uses a path for a tree of depth 4 and tries to do next on
 2745:         %% each of those paths.
 2746:         (fun F(0) -> ok;
 2747:              F(N) ->
 2748:                  try maps:next([N|FM]) of
 2749:                      none ->
 2750:                          F(N-1);
 2751:                      {_K,_V,_I} ->
 2752:                          F(N-1)
 2753:                  catch error:badarg ->
 2754:                          F(N-1)
 2755:                  end
 2756:          end)(16#FFFF),
 2757: 
 2758:         ok
 2759:     after
 2760:             erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 2761:     end.
 2762: 
 2763: verify_iterator(Map) ->
 2764:     KVs = t_fold(fun(K, V, A) -> [{K, V} | A] end, [], Map),
 2765: 
 2766:     %% Verify that KVs created by iterating Map is of
 2767:     %% correct size and contains all elements
 2768:     true = length(KVs) == maps:size(Map),
 2769:     [maps:get(K, Map) || {K, _} <- KVs],
 2770:     ok.
 2771: 
 2772: 
 2773: t_fold(Fun, Init, Map) ->
 2774:     t_fold_1(Fun, Init, maps:iterator(Map)).
 2775: 
 2776: t_fold_1(Fun, Acc, Iter) ->
 2777:     case maps:next(Iter) of
 2778:         {K, V, NextIter} ->
 2779:             t_fold_1(Fun, Fun(K,V,Acc), NextIter);
 2780:         none ->
 2781:             Acc
 2782:     end.
 2783: 
 2784: t_bif_build_and_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2785:     ok = check_build_and_remove(750,[fun(K) -> [K,K] end,
 2786: 				     fun(K) -> [float(K),K] end,
 2787: 				     fun(K) -> K end,
 2788: 				     fun(K) -> {1,K} end,
 2789: 				     fun(K) -> {K} end,
 2790: 				     fun(K) -> [K|K] end,
 2791: 				     fun(K) -> [K,1,2,3,4] end,
 2792: 				     fun(K) -> {K,atom} end,
 2793: 				     fun(K) -> float(K) end,
 2794: 				     fun(K) -> integer_to_list(K) end,
 2795: 				     fun(K) -> list_to_atom(integer_to_list(K)) end,
 2796: 				     fun(K) -> [K,{K,[K,{K,[K]}]}] end,
 2797: 				     fun(K) -> <<K:32>> end]),
 2798:     ok.
 2799: 
 2800: check_build_and_remove(_,[]) -> ok;
 2801: check_build_and_remove(N,[F|Fs]) ->
 2802:     {M,Ks} = build_and_check(N, maps:new(), F, []),
 2803:     ok     = remove_and_check(Ks,M),
 2804:     check_build_and_remove(N,Fs).
 2805: 
 2806: build_and_check(0, M0, _, Ks) -> {M0, Ks};
 2807: build_and_check(N, M0, F, Ks) ->
 2808:     K  = build_key(F,N),
 2809:     M1 = maps:put(K,K,M0),
 2810:     ok = check_keys_exist([I||{I,_} <- [{K,M1}|Ks]], M1),
 2811:     M2 = maps:update(K,v,M1),
 2812:     v  = maps:get(K,M2),
 2813:     build_and_check(N-1,M1,F,[{K,M1}|Ks]).
 2814: 
 2815: remove_and_check([],_) -> ok;
 2816: remove_and_check([{K,Mc}|Ks], M0) ->
 2817:     K     = maps:get(K,M0),
 2818:     true  = maps:is_key(K,M0),
 2819:     true  = Mc =:= M0,
 2820:     true  = M0 == Mc,
 2821:     M1    = maps:remove(K,M0),
 2822:     false = M1 =:= Mc,
 2823:     false = Mc == M1,
 2824:     false = maps:is_key(K,M1),
 2825:     true  = maps:is_key(K,M0),
 2826:     ok    = check_keys_exist([I||{I,_} <- Ks],M1),
 2827:     error = maps:find(K,M1),
 2828:     remove_and_check(Ks, M1).
 2829: 
 2830: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 0 -> F(N);
 2831: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 1 -> K = F(N), {K,K};
 2832: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 2 -> K = F(N), [K,K].
 2833: 
 2834: check_keys_exist([], _) -> ok;
 2835: check_keys_exist([K|Ks],M) ->
 2836:     true = maps:is_key(K,M),
 2837:     check_keys_exist(Ks,M).
 2838: 
 2839: t_bif_merge_and_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2840: 
 2841:     io:format("rand:export_seed() -> ~p\n",[rand:export_seed()]),
 2842: 
 2843:     %% simple disjunct ones
 2844:     %% make sure all keys are unique
 2845:     Kss = [[a,b,c,d],
 2846: 	   [1,2,3,4],
 2847: 	   [],
 2848: 	   ["hi"],
 2849: 	   [e],
 2850: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> {small,K} end, I) || I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2851: 	   lists:seq(5, 28),
 2852: 	   lists:seq(29, 59),
 2853: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> integer_to_list(K) end, I) || I <- lists:seq(2000,10000)],
 2854: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> <<K:32>> end, I) || I <- lists:seq(1,80)],
 2855: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> {<<K:32>>} end, I) || I <- lists:seq(100,1000)]],
 2856: 
 2857: 
 2858:     KsMs = build_keys_map_pairs(Kss),
 2859:     Cs   = [{CKs1,CM1,CKs2,CM2} || {CKs1,CM1} <- KsMs, {CKs2,CM2} <- KsMs],
 2860:     ok   = merge_and_check_combo(Cs),
 2861: 
 2862:     %% overlapping ones
 2863: 
 2864:     KVs1 = [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}],
 2865:     KVs2 = [{b,3},{c,4},{d,5}],
 2866:     KVs  = [{I,I} || I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2867:     KVs3 = KVs1 ++ KVs,
 2868:     KVs4 = KVs2 ++ KVs,
 2869: 
 2870:     M1  = maps:from_list(KVs1),
 2871:     M2  = maps:from_list(KVs2),
 2872:     M3  = maps:from_list(KVs3),
 2873:     M4  = maps:from_list(KVs4),
 2874: 
 2875:     M12 = maps:merge(M1,M2),
 2876:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs2 ++ [{a,1}], M12),
 2877:     M21 = maps:merge(M2,M1),
 2878:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs1 ++ [{d,5}], M21),
 2879: 
 2880:     M34 = maps:merge(M3,M4),
 2881:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs4 ++ [{a,1}], M34),
 2882:     M43 = maps:merge(M4,M3),
 2883:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs3 ++ [{d,5}], M43),
 2884: 
 2885:     M14 = maps:merge(M1,M4),
 2886:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs4 ++ [{a,1}], M14),
 2887:     M41 = maps:merge(M4,M1),
 2888:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs1 ++ [{d,5}] ++ KVs, M41),
 2889: 
 2890:     [begin Ma = random_map(SzA, a),
 2891: 	   Mb = random_map(SzB, b),
 2892: 	   ok = merge_maps(Ma, Mb)
 2893:      end || SzA <- [3,10,20,100,200,1000], SzB <- [3,10,20,100,200,1000]],
 2894: 
 2895:     ok.
 2896: 
 2897: % Generate random map with an average of Sz number of pairs: K -> {V,K}
 2898: random_map(Sz, V) ->
 2899:     random_map_insert(#{}, 0, V, Sz*2).
 2900: 
 2901: random_map_insert(M0, K0, _, Sz) when K0 > Sz ->
 2902:     M0;
 2903: random_map_insert(M0, K0, V, Sz) ->
 2904:     Key = K0 + rand:uniform(3),
 2905:     random_map_insert(M0#{Key => {V,Key}}, Key, V, Sz).
 2906: 
 2907: 
 2908: merge_maps(A, B) ->
 2909:     AB = maps:merge(A, B),
 2910:     %%io:format("A=~p\nB=~p\n",[A,B]),
 2911:     maps_foreach(fun(K,VB) -> VB = maps:get(K, AB)
 2912: 		 end, B),
 2913:     maps_foreach(fun(K,VA) ->
 2914: 			 case {maps:get(K, AB),maps:find(K, B)} of
 2915: 			     {VA, error} -> ok;
 2916: 			     {VB, {ok, VB}} -> ok
 2917: 			 end
 2918: 		 end, A),
 2919: 
 2920:     maps_foreach(fun(K,V) ->
 2921: 			 case {maps:find(K, A),maps:find(K, B)} of
 2922: 			     {{ok, V}, error} -> ok;
 2923: 			     {error, {ok, V}} -> ok;
 2924: 			     {{ok,_}, {ok, V}} -> ok
 2925: 			 end
 2926: 		 end, AB),
 2927:     ok.
 2928: 
 2929: maps_foreach(Fun, Map) ->
 2930:     maps:fold(fun(K,V,_) -> Fun(K,V) end, void, Map).
 2931: 
 2932: 
 2933: check_key_values([],_) -> ok;
 2934: check_key_values([{K,V}|KVs],M) ->
 2935:     V = maps:get(K,M),
 2936:     check_key_values(KVs,M).
 2937: 
 2938: merge_and_check_combo([]) -> ok;
 2939: merge_and_check_combo([{Ks1,M1,Ks2,M2}|Cs]) ->
 2940:     M12 = maps:merge(M1,M2),
 2941:     ok  = check_keys_exist(Ks1 ++ Ks2, M12),
 2942:     M21 = maps:merge(M2,M1),
 2943:     ok  = check_keys_exist(Ks1 ++ Ks2, M21),
 2944: 
 2945:     true = M12 =:= M21,
 2946:     M12  = M21,
 2947: 
 2948:     merge_and_check_combo(Cs).
 2949: 
 2950: build_keys_map_pairs([]) -> [];
 2951: build_keys_map_pairs([Ks|Kss]) ->
 2952:     M  = maps:from_list(keys_to_pairs(Ks)),
 2953:     ok = check_keys_exist(Ks, M),
 2954:     [{Ks,M}|build_keys_map_pairs(Kss)].
 2955: 
 2956: keys_to_pairs(Ks) -> [{K,K} || K <- Ks].
 2957: 
 2958: 
 2959: %% Maps module, not BIFs
 2960: t_maps_fold(_Config) ->
 2961:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2962:     M  = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-Vs]),
 2963: 
 2964:     %% fold
 2965:     5050 = maps:fold(fun({k,_},{v,V},A) -> V + A end, 0, M),
 2966: 
 2967:     ok.
 2968: 
 2969: t_maps_map(_Config) ->
 2970:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2971:     M1 = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-Vs]),
 2972:     M2 = maps:from_list([{I,{token,I}}||I<-Vs]),
 2973: 
 2974:     M2 = maps:map(fun(_K,V) -> {token,V} end, M1),
 2975:     ok.
 2976: 
 2977: t_maps_size(_Config) ->
 2978:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2979:     lists:foldl(fun(I,M) ->
 2980: 		M1 = maps:put(I,I,M),
 2981: 		I  = maps:size(M1),
 2982: 		M1
 2983: 	end, #{}, Vs),
 2984:     ok.
 2985: 
 2986: 
 2987: t_maps_without(_Config) ->
 2988:     Ki = [11,22,33,44,55,66,77,88,99],
 2989:     M0 = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-lists:seq(1,100)]),
 2990:     M1 = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-lists:seq(1,100) -- Ki]),
 2991:     M1 = maps:without([{k,I}||I <- Ki],M0),
 2992:     ok.
 2993: 
 2994: 
 2995: %% MISC
 2996: 
 2997: %% Verify that the the number of nodes in hashmaps
 2998: %% of different types and sizes does not deviate too
 2999: %% much from the theoretical model.
 3000: %% For debug with DBG_HASHMAP_COLLISION_BONANZA the test will expect
 3001: %% the hashmaps to NOT be well balanced.
 3002: t_hashmap_balance(_Config) ->
 3003:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3004:     ExpectBalance = not erts_debug:get_internal_state(hashmap_collision_bonanza),
 3005:     hashmap_balance(ExpectBalance),
 3006:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
 3007:     ok.
 3008: 
 3009: hashmap_balance(EB) ->
 3010:     io:format("Integer keys\n", []),
 3011:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> I end, EB),
 3012:     io:format("Float keys\n", []),
 3013:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> float(I) end, EB),
 3014:     io:format("String keys\n", []),
 3015:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> integer_to_list(I) end, EB),
 3016:     io:format("Binary (big) keys\n", []),
 3017:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> <<I:16/big>> end, EB),
 3018:     io:format("Binary (little) keys\n", []),
 3019:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> <<I:16/little>> end, EB),
 3020:     io:format("Atom keys\n", []),
 3021:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> erts_debug:get_internal_state({atom,I}) end, EB),
 3022:     ok.
 3023: 
 3024: hashmap_balance(KeyFun, ExpectBalance) ->
 3025:     %% For uniformly distributed hash values, the average number of nodes N
 3026:     %% in a hashmap varies between 0.3*K and 0.4*K where K is number of keys.
 3027:     %% The standard deviation of N is about sqrt(K)/3.
 3028: 
 3029:     %% For simplicity we use the higher expected average 0.4*K
 3030:     %% and verfies that no map is too many standard deviation above it.
 3031: 
 3032:     F = fun(I, {M0,Max0}) ->
 3033: 		Key = KeyFun(I),
 3034: 		M1 = M0#{Key => Key},
 3035: 		Max1 = case erts_internal:term_type(M1) of
 3036: 			   hashmap ->
 3037: 			       Nodes = hashmap_nodes(M1),
 3038: 			       Avg = maps:size(M1) * 0.4,
 3039: 			       StdDev = math:sqrt(maps:size(M1)) / 3,
 3040: 			       SD_diff = abs(Nodes - Avg) / StdDev,
 3041: 			       %%io:format("~p keys: ~p nodes avg=~p SD_diff=~p\n",
 3042: 			       %%          [maps:size(M1), Nodes, Avg, SD_diff]),
 3043: 			       {MaxDiff0, _, Cnt} = Max0,
 3044: 			       case {Nodes > Avg, SD_diff > MaxDiff0} of
 3045: 				   {true, true} -> {SD_diff, M1, Cnt+1};
 3046: 				   _ -> Max0
 3047: 			       end;
 3048: 
 3049: 			   flatmap -> Max0
 3050: 		       end,
 3051: 		{M1, Max1}
 3052: 	end,
 3053: 
 3054:     {_,{MaxDiff,MaxMap, FatCnt}} = lists:foldl(F,
 3055: 					       {#{}, {0, undefined, 0}},
 3056: 					       lists:seq(1,10000)),
 3057:     case MaxMap of
 3058: 	undefined ->
 3059: 	    io:format("Wow, no map with more than \"average\" number of nodes\n");
 3060: 	_ ->
 3061: 	    io:format("Found ~p maps with more than \"average\" number of nodes\n",
 3062: 		      [FatCnt]),
 3063: 	    io:format("Max std dev diff ~p for map of size ~p (nodes=~p, flatsize=~p)\n",
 3064: 		      [MaxDiff, maps:size(MaxMap), hashmap_nodes(MaxMap),
 3065: 		       erts_debug:flat_size(MaxMap)])
 3066:     end,
 3067: 
 3068:     %% The probability of this line failing is about 0.000000001
 3069:     %% for a uniform hash. I've set the probability this "high" for now
 3070:     %% to detect flaws in our make_internal_hash.
 3071:     ExpectBalance = (MaxDiff < 6),
 3072:     ok.
 3073: 
 3074: hashmap_nodes(M) ->
 3075:     Info = erts_debug:map_info(M),
 3076:     lists:foldl(fun(Tpl,Acc) ->
 3077: 			case element(1,Tpl) of
 3078: 			    bitmaps -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 3079: 			    arrays -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 3080: 			    collisions -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 3081: 			    _ -> Acc
 3082: 			end
 3083: 		end,
 3084: 		0,
 3085: 		Info).
 3086: 
 3087: t_erts_internal_order(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3088: 
 3089:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,2),
 3090:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2,1),
 3091:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2,2),
 3092: 
 3093: 
 3094:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,a),
 3095:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,1),
 3096:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,a),
 3097: 
 3098:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,1.0),
 3099:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1.0,1),
 3100:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1.0,1.0),
 3101: 
 3102:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,1 bsl 65),
 3103:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65,1),
 3104:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65, 1 bsl 65),
 3105: 
 3106:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65,float(1)),
 3107:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1),1 bsl 65),
 3108:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,float(1 bsl 65)),
 3109:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1 bsl 65),1),
 3110:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1 bsl 65), float(1 bsl 65)),
 3111: 
 3112:     %% reported errors
 3113:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(0,2147483648),
 3114:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2147483648,2147483648),
 3115:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2147483648,0),
 3116: 
 3117:     %% Make sure it's not the internal flatmap order
 3118:     %% where low indexed 'true' < 'a'.
 3119:     -1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,true),
 3120: 
 3121:     M = #{0 => 0,2147483648 => 0},
 3122:     true = M =:= binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M)),
 3123:     true = M =:= binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M, [deterministic])),
 3124: 
 3125:     F1 = fun(_, _) -> 0 end,
 3126:     F2 = fun(_, _) -> 1 end,
 3127:     M0 = maps:from_list( [{-2147483649, 0}, {0,0}, {97, 0}, {false, 0}, {flower, 0}, {F1, 0}, {F2, 0}, {<<>>, 0}]),
 3128:     M1 = maps:merge(M0, #{0 => 1}),
 3129:     8  = maps:size(M1),
 3130:     1  = maps:get(0,M1),
 3131:     ok.
 3132: 
 3133: t_erts_internal_hash(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3134:     K1 = 0.0,
 3135:     K2 = 0.0/-1,
 3136:     M  = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-lists:seq(1,32)]),
 3137: 
 3138:     M1 = M#{ K1 => a, K2 => b },
 3139:     b  = maps:get(K2,M1),
 3140: 
 3141:     M2 = M#{ K2 => a, K1 => b },
 3142:     b  = maps:get(K1,M2),
 3143: 
 3144:     %% test previously faulty hash list optimization
 3145: 
 3146:     M3 = M#{[0] => a, [0,0] => b, [0,0,0] => c, [0,0,0,0] => d},
 3147:     a  = maps:get([0],M3),
 3148:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M3),
 3149:     c  = maps:get([0,0,0],M3),
 3150:     d  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M3),
 3151: 
 3152:     M4 = M#{{[0]} => a, {[0,0]} => b, {[0,0,0]} => c, {[0,0,0,0]} => d},
 3153:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M4),
 3154:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M4),
 3155:     c  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M4),
 3156:     d  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M4),
 3157: 
 3158:     M5 = M3#{[0,0,0] => e, [0,0,0,0] => f, [0,0,0,0,0] => g,
 3159:              [0,0,0,0,0,0] => h, [0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => i,
 3160:              [0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => j, [0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => k},
 3161: 
 3162:     a  = maps:get([0],M5),
 3163:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M5),
 3164:     e  = maps:get([0,0,0],M5),
 3165:     f  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M5),
 3166:     g  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3167:     h  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3168:     i  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3169:     j  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3170:     k  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3171: 
 3172:     M6 = M4#{{[0,0,0]} => e, {[0,0,0,0]} => f, {[0,0,0,0,0]} => g,
 3173:              {[0,0,0,0,0,0]} => h, {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => i,
 3174:              {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => j, {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => k},
 3175: 
 3176:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M6),
 3177:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M6),
 3178:     e  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M6),
 3179:     f  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3180:     g  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3181:     h  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3182:     i  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3183:     j  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3184:     k  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3185: 
 3186:     M7 = maps:merge(M5,M6),
 3187: 
 3188:     a  = maps:get([0],M7),
 3189:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M7),
 3190:     e  = maps:get([0,0,0],M7),
 3191:     f  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M7),
 3192:     g  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3193:     h  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3194:     i  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3195:     j  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3196:     k  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3197:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M7),
 3198:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M7),
 3199:     e  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M7),
 3200:     f  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3201:     g  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3202:     h  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3203:     i  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3204:     j  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3205:     k  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3206: 
 3207:     %% Test that external pids and ports don't introduce hash clash,
 3208:     %% caused by high word being ignored (OTP-17436).
 3209:     maps:from_keys([erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({a@a, 17},
 3210: 					       1 bsl NumBit,
 3211: 					       1 bsl SerBit)
 3212: 		    || NumBit <- lists:seq(0, 31),
 3213: 		       SerBit <- lists:seq(0, 31)],
 3214: 		   1),
 3215:     maps:from_keys([erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({a@a, 17}, 1 bsl NumBit)
 3216: 		    || NumBit <- lists:seq(0, 63)],
 3217: 		   1),
 3218: 
 3219:     ok.

 3221: t_pdict(_Config) ->
 3222: 
 3223:     put(#{ a => b, b => a},#{ c => d}),
 3224:     put(get(#{ a => b, b => a}),1),
 3225:     1 = get(#{ c => d}),
 3226:     #{ c := d } = get(#{ a => b, b => a}).

 3228: t_ets(_Config) ->
 3229: 
 3230:     Tid = ets:new(map_table,[]),
 3231: 
 3232:     [ets:insert(Tid,{maps:from_list([{I,-I}]),I}) || I <- lists:seq(1,100)],
 3233: 
 3234: 
 3235:     [{#{ 2 := -2},2}] = ets:lookup(Tid,#{ 2 => -2 }),
 3236: 
 3237:     %% Test equal
 3238:     [3,4] = lists:sort(
 3239: 	      ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','$2'},
 3240: 			       [{'or',{'==','$1',#{ 3 => -3 }},
 3241: 				 {'==','$1',#{ 4 => -4 }}}],
 3242: 			       ['$2']}])),
 3243:     %% Test match
 3244:     [30,50] = lists:sort(
 3245: 		ets:select(Tid,
 3246: 			   [{{#{ 30 => -30}, '$1'},[],['$1']},
 3247: 			    {{#{ 50 => -50}, '$1'},[],['$1']}]
 3248: 			  )),
 3249: 
 3250:     ets:insert(Tid,{#{ a => b, b => c, c => a},transitivity}),
 3251: 
 3252:     %% Test equal with map of different size
 3253:     [] = ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','_'},[{'==','$1',#{ b => c }}],['$_']}]),
 3254: 
 3255:     %% Test match with map of different size
 3256:     %[{#{ a := b },_}] = ets:select(Tid,[{{#{ b => c },'_'},[],['$_']}]),
 3257: 
 3258:     %%% Test match with don't care value
 3259:     %[{#{ a := b },_}] = ets:select(Tid,[{{#{ b => '_' },'_'},[],['$_']}]),
 3260: 
 3261:     %% Test is_map bif
 3262:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3263:     ets:insert(Tid,{not_a_map,2}),
 3264:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3265:     ets:insert(Tid,{{nope,a,tuple},2}),
 3266:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3267: 
 3268:     %% Test map_size bif
 3269:     [3] = ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','_'},[{'==',{map_size,'$1'},3}],
 3270: 			   [{map_size,'$1'}]}]),
 3271: 
 3272:     true = ets:delete(Tid,#{50 => -50}),
 3273:     [] = ets:lookup(Tid,#{50 => -50}),
 3274: 
 3275:     ets:delete(Tid),
 3276:     ok.
 3277: 
 3278: t_dets(_Config) ->
 3279:     ok.
 3280: 
 3281: t_tracing(_Config) ->
 3282: 
 3283:     dbg:stop(),
 3284:     {ok,Tracer} = dbg:tracer(process,{fun trace_collector/2, self()}),
 3285:     dbg:p(self(),c),
 3286: 
 3287:     %% Test basic map call
 3288:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,x),
 3289:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3290:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ a := b }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3291:     {trace,_,return_from,{?MODULE,id,1},#{ a := b }} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3292:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3293: 
 3294:     %% Test equals in argument list
 3295:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{'==','$1',#{ b => c}}],
 3296: 				  [{return_trace}]}]),
 3297:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3298:     id(#{ b => c }),
 3299:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ b := c }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3300:     {trace,_,return_from,{?MODULE,id,1},#{ b := c }} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3301:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3302: 
 3303:     %% Test match in head
 3304:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{[#{b => c}],[],[]}]),
 3305:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3306:     id(#{ b => c }),
 3307:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ b := c }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3308:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3309: 
 3310:     % Test map guard bifs
 3311:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],[]}]),
 3312:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3313:     id({1,2}),
 3314:     id({#{ a => b},2}),
 3315:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[{#{ a := b },2}]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3316:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3317: 
 3318:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{'==',{map_size,{element,1,'$1'}},2}],[]}]),
 3319:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3320:     id({1,2}),
 3321:     id({#{ a => b},2}),
 3322:     id({#{ a => b, b => c},atom}),
 3323:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[{#{ a := b, b := c },atom}]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3324:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3325: 
 3326:     %MS = dbg:fun2ms(fun([A]) when A == #{ a => b} -> ok end),
 3327:     %dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,MS),
 3328:     %id(#{ a => b }),
 3329:     %id(#{ b => c }),
 3330:     %{trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ a := b }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3331:     %dbg:ctpl(),
 3332: 
 3333:     %% Check to extra messages
 3334:     timeout = getmsg(Tracer),
 3335: 
 3336:     dbg:stop(),
 3337:     ok.
 3338: 
 3339: getmsg(_Tracer) ->
 3340:     receive V -> V after 100 -> timeout end.
 3341: 
 3342: trace_collector(Msg,Parent) ->
 3343:     io:format("~p~n",[Msg]),
 3344:     Parent ! Msg,
 3345:     Parent.
 3346: 
 3347: t_has_map_fields(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3348:     true = has_map_fields_1(#{one=>1}),
 3349:     true = has_map_fields_1(#{one=>1,two=>2}),
 3350:     false = has_map_fields_1(#{two=>2}),
 3351:     false = has_map_fields_1(#{}),
 3352: 
 3353:     true = has_map_fields_2(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3}),
 3354:     true = has_map_fields_2(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3,x=>42}),
 3355:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{b=>2,c=>1}),
 3356:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{x=>y}),
 3357:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{}),
 3358: 
 3359:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3}),
 3360:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3,[]=>42}),
 3361:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{b=>2,a=>3,[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3362:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{a=>3,[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3363:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3364:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{b=>2,c=>1}),
 3365:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{[]=>y}),
 3366:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{42.0=>x,a=>99}),
 3367:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{}),
 3368: 
 3369:     ok.
 3370: 
 3371: has_map_fields_1(#{one:=_}) -> true;
 3372: has_map_fields_1(#{}) -> false.
 3373: 
 3374: has_map_fields_2(#{a:=_,b:=_,c:=_}) -> true;
 3375: has_map_fields_2(#{}) -> false.
 3376: 
 3377: has_map_fields_3(#{a:=_,b:=_}) -> true;
 3378: has_map_fields_3(#{[]:=_,42.0:=_}) -> true;
 3379: has_map_fields_3(#{}) -> false.
 3380: 
 3381: t_get_map_elements(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3382:     %% Tests that the JIT implementation of `get_map_elements` handles
 3383:     %% collisions properly.
 3384:     N = 500000,
 3385:     Is = lists:seq(1, N),
 3386:     Test = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-Is]),
 3387:     [begin
 3388:          #{ Key := Val } = Test,
 3389:          Key = Val
 3390:      end || Key <- Is],
 3391: 
 3392:     ok.
 3393: 
 3394: y_regs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3395:     Val = [length(Config)],
 3396:     Map0 = y_regs_update(#{}, Val),
 3397:     Map2 = y_regs_update(Map0, Val),
 3398: 
 3399:     Map3 = maps:from_list([{I,I*I} || I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 3400:     Map4 = y_regs_update(Map3, Val),
 3401: 
 3402:     true = is_map(Map2) andalso is_map(Map4),
 3403: 
 3404:     gurka = y_regs_literal(0),
 3405:     gaffel = y_regs_literal(1),
 3406: 
 3407:     ok.
 3408: 
 3409: y_regs_literal(Key) when is_integer(Key) ->
 3410:     %% Forces the key to be placed in a Y register.
 3411:     lists:seq(1, 2),
 3412:     case is_map_key(Key, #{ 0 => 0 }) of
 3413:         true -> gurka;
 3414:         false -> gaffel
 3415:     end.
 3416: 
 3417: y_regs_update(Map0, Val0) ->
 3418:     Val1 = {t,Val0},
 3419:     K1 = id({key,1}),
 3420:     K2 = id({key,2}),
 3421:     Map1 = Map0#{K1=>K1,
 3422: 		 a=>Val0,b=>Val0,c=>Val0,d=>Val0,e=>Val0,
 3423: 		 f=>Val0,g=>Val0,h=>Val0,i=>Val0,j=>Val0,
 3424: 		 k=>Val0,l=>Val0,m=>Val0,n=>Val0,o=>Val0,
 3425: 		 p=>Val0,q=>Val0,r=>Val0,s=>Val0,t=>Val0,
 3426: 		 u=>Val0,v=>Val0,w=>Val0,x=>Val0,y=>Val0,
 3427: 		 z=>Val0,
 3428: 		 aa=>Val0,ab=>Val0,ac=>Val0,ad=>Val0,ae=>Val0,
 3429: 		 af=>Val0,ag=>Val0,ah=>Val0,ai=>Val0,aj=>Val0,
 3430: 		 ak=>Val0,al=>Val0,am=>Val0,an=>Val0,ao=>Val0,
 3431: 		 ap=>Val0,aq=>Val0,ar=>Val0,as=>Val0,at=>Val0,
 3432: 		 au=>Val0,av=>Val0,aw=>Val0,ax=>Val0,ay=>Val0,
 3433: 		 az=>Val0,
 3434: 		 K2=>[a,b,c]},
 3435:     Map2 = Map1#{K1=>K1,
 3436: 		 a:=Val1,b:=Val1,c:=Val1,d:=Val1,e:=Val1,
 3437: 		 f:=Val1,g:=Val1,h:=Val1,i:=Val1,j:=Val1,
 3438: 		 k:=Val1,l:=Val1,m:=Val1,n:=Val1,o:=Val1,
 3439: 		 p:=Val1,q:=Val1,r:=Val1,s:=Val1,t:=Val1,
 3440: 		 u:=Val1,v:=Val1,w:=Val1,x:=Val1,y:=Val1,
 3441: 		 z:=Val1,
 3442: 		 aa:=Val1,ab:=Val1,ac:=Val1,ad:=Val1,ae:=Val1,
 3443: 		 af:=Val1,ag:=Val1,ah:=Val1,ai:=Val1,aj:=Val1,
 3444: 		 ak:=Val1,al:=Val1,am:=Val1,an:=Val1,ao:=Val1,
 3445: 		 ap:=Val1,aq:=Val1,ar:=Val1,as:=Val1,at:=Val1,
 3446: 		 au:=Val1,av:=Val1,aw:=Val1,ax:=Val1,ay:=Val1,
 3447: 		 az:=Val1,
 3448: 		 K2=>[a,b,c]},
 3449: 
 3450:     %% Traverse the maps to validate them.
 3451:     _ = erlang:phash2({Map1,Map2}, 100000),
 3452: 
 3453:     _ = id({K1,K2,Val0,Val1}),			%Force use of Y registers.
 3454:     Map2.
 3455: 
 3456: do_badmap(Test) ->
 3457:     Terms = [Test,fun erlang:abs/1,make_ref(),self(),0.0/id(-1),
 3458: 	     <<0:1024>>,<<1:1>>,<<>>,<<1,2,3>>,
 3459: 	     [],{a,b,c},[a,b],atom,10.0,42,(1 bsl 65) + 3],
 3460:     [Test(T) || T <- Terms].
 3461: 
 3462: %% Use this function to avoid compile-time evaluation of an expression.
 3463: id(I) -> I.
 3464: 
 3465: 
 3466: %% OTP-13763
 3467: t_hash_entropy(Config) when is_list(Config)  ->
 3468:     %% entropy bug in 18.3, 19.0
 3469:     M1 = maps:from_list([{#{"id" => I}, ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,50000)]),
 3470: 
 3471:     #{ #{"id" => 100} := ok,
 3472:        #{"id" => 200} := ok,
 3473:        #{"id" => 300} := ok,
 3474:        #{"id" => 400} := ok,
 3475:        #{"id" => 500} := ok,
 3476:        #{"id" => 600} := ok,
 3477:        #{"id" => 700} := ok,
 3478:        #{"id" => 800} := ok,
 3479:        #{"id" => 900} := ok,
 3480:        #{"id" => 25061} := ok,
 3481:        #{"id" => 39766} := ok } = M1,
 3482: 
 3483:     M0 = maps:from_list([{I,ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,33)]),
 3484:     M2 = maps:from_list([{M0#{"id" => I}, ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,50000)]),
 3485: 
 3486:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 100}, M2),
 3487:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 200}, M2),
 3488:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 300}, M2),
 3489:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 400}, M2),
 3490:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 500}, M2),
 3491:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 600}, M2),
 3492:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 700}, M2),
 3493:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 800}, M2),
 3494:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 900}, M2),
 3495:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 25061}, M2),
 3496:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 39766}, M2),
 3497:     ok.
 3498: 
 3499: %% OTP-13146
 3500: %% Provoke major GC with a lot of "fat" maps on external format in msg queue
 3501: %% causing heap fragments to be allocated.
 3502: t_gc_rare_map_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3503:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3504:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3505:     try
 3506: 	Echo = spawn_link(Node, fun Loop() -> receive {From,Msg} -> From ! Msg
 3507: 					      end,
 3508: 					      Loop()
 3509: 				end),
 3510: 	FatMap = fatmap(34),
 3511: 	false = (flatmap =:= erts_internal:term_type(FatMap)),
 3512: 
 3513: 	t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, fun() -> erlang:garbage_collect() end),
 3514: 
 3515: 	%% Repeat test for minor gc:
 3516: 	t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, fun() -> minor_collect() end),
 3517: 
 3518: 	unlink(Echo),
 3519: 
 3520: 	%% Test fatmap in exit signal
 3521: 	Exiter = spawn_link(Node, fun Loop() -> receive {_From,Msg} ->
 3522: 							"not_a_map" = Msg  % badmatch!
 3523: 						end,
 3524: 						Loop()
 3525: 				  end),
 3526: 	process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3527: 	Exiter ! {self(), FatMap},
 3528: 	{'EXIT', Exiter, {{badmatch,FatMap}, _}} = receive M -> M end,
 3529: 	ok
 3530: 
 3531:     after
 3532: 	process_flag(trap_exit, false),
 3533: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
 3534: 	peer:stop(Peer)
 3535:     end.
 3536: 
 3537: t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, GcFun) ->
 3538:     Master = self(),
 3539:     true = receive _M -> false after 0 -> true end,   % assert empty msg queue
 3540:     Echo ! {Master, token},
 3541:     repeat(1000, fun(_) -> Echo ! {Master, FatMap} end, void),
 3542: 
 3543:     timer:sleep(100),                % Wait for maps to arrive in our msg queue
 3544:     token = receive Tok -> Tok end,  % and provoke move from outer to inner msg queue
 3545: 
 3546:     %% Do GC that will "overflow" and create heap frags due to all the fat maps
 3547:     GcFun(),
 3548: 
 3549:     %% Now check that all maps in msg queueu are intact
 3550:     %% Will crash emulator in OTP-18.1
 3551:     repeat(1000, fun(_) -> FatMap = receive FM -> FM end end, void),
 3552:     ok.
 3553: 
 3554: minor_collect() ->
 3555:     Before = minor_gcs(),
 3556:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(force_gc, self()),
 3557:     erlang:yield(),
 3558:     After = minor_gcs(),
 3559:     io:format("minor_gcs: ~p -> ~p\n", [Before, After]).
 3560: 
 3561: minor_gcs() ->
 3562:     {garbage_collection, Info} = process_info(self(), garbage_collection),
 3563:     {minor_gcs, GCS} = lists:keyfind(minor_gcs, 1, Info),
 3564:     GCS.
 3565: 
 3566: %% Generate a map with N (or N+1) keys that have an abnormal heap demand. Done
 3567: %% by finding keys that collide in the first 32 bits of the hash.
 3568: fatmap(N) ->
 3569:     Groups0 = colliding_keys(),
 3570:     Groups = lists:nthtail(length(Groups0) - (N div 2), Groups0),
 3571:     Keys = lists:append([[A, B] || [A, B | _Rest] <- Groups]),
 3572:     maps:from_keys(Keys, []).
 3573: 
 3574: colliding_keys() ->
 3575:     %% Collide to 8 levels, anything more than this takes way too long to
 3576:     %% generate.
 3577:     Mask = 16#FFFFFFFF,
 3578: 
 3579:     %% Collisions found by find_colliding_keys(Mask) below. When regenerating
 3580:     %% keys, make sure to run it outside testing as it might time-trap
 3581:     %% otherwise.
 3582:     %%
 3583:     %% io:format("Finding new colliding keys for mask ~p~n", [Mask]),
 3584:     %% io:format("Colliding keys\n\t~p\n", [find_colliding_keys(Mask)]),
 3585:     ByMethod = #{
 3586:         %% 64-bit internal hash of `0`
 3587:         15677855740172624429 =>
 3588:             [[-4294967296,-3502771103,1628104549],
 3589:              [-2750312253,-2208396507,-2147483648,1926198452,3660971145],
 3590:              [-2542330914,-1089175976,-1073741824,290495829],
 3591:              [-2155350068,0],
 3592:              [1073741824,2807978463,3625918826],
 3593:              [-1032333168,-705082324,1541401419,1594347321,2147483648,
 3594:               2266580263,2823045213],
 3595:              [-2465550512,3221225472],
 3596:              [2854075383,651030299,-1581781966,-3419595364,-4294967295],
 3597:              [3351133532,968011333,-2217176682,-4294967294],
 3598:              [598547769,-1379599129,-4294967293],
 3599:              [-649195724,-4294967292],
 3600:              [2943767758,-645518858,-875893937,-1294474094,-4294967291],
 3601:              [3255309205,-2208705073,-4294967290],
 3602:              [2162086262,-3745041100,-4294967288],
 3603:              [-36087602,-1146855151,-1687820340,-3221225471],
 3604:              [4177844763,3846951687,3485974116,3175597814,590007752,

 3704: 
 3705:     HashKey = internal_hash(0),
 3706:     #{ HashKey := Keys } = ByMethod,
 3707: 
 3708:     verify_colliding_keys(Keys, Mask).
 3709: 
 3710: verify_colliding_keys([[K | Ks]=Group | Gs], Mask) ->
 3711:     Hash = internal_hash(K) band Mask,
 3712:     [Hash] = lists:usort([(internal_hash(Key) band Mask) || Key <- Ks]),
 3713:     [Group | verify_colliding_keys(Gs, Mask)];
 3714: verify_colliding_keys([], _Mask) ->
 3715:     [].
 3716: 
 3717: %% Use this function to (re)generate the list in colliding_keys/0. This takes
 3718: %% several hours to run so you may want to run it overnight.
 3719: find_colliding_keys(Mask) ->
 3720:     NumScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 3721:     %% Stay below the limit for smalls on 32-bit platforms to prevent the
 3722:     %% search from taking forever due to bignums.
 3723:     Start = -(1 bsl 27),
 3724:     End = -Start,
 3725:     Range = End - Start,
 3726:     Step = Range div NumScheds,
 3727:     timer:tc(fun() ->
 3728:                     ckf_spawn(NumScheds, NumScheds, Start, End, Step, Mask, [])
 3729:                 end).
 3730: 
 3731: ckf_spawn(0, _NumScheds, _Start, _End, _Step, _Mask, Refs) ->
 3732:     lists:append(ckf_await(Refs));
 3733: ckf_spawn(N, NumScheds, Start, End, Step, Mask, Refs) ->
 3734:     Keys = [Start + Z + (N - 1) * Step || Z <- lists:seq(1, 128)],
 3735:     {_, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 3736:                                      exit(ckf_finder(Start, End, Mask, Keys))
 3737:                              end),
 3738:     ckf_spawn(N - 1, NumScheds, Start, End, Step, Mask, [Ref | Refs]).
 3739: 
 3740: ckf_await([Ref | Refs]) ->
 3741:     receive
 3742:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, []} ->
 3743:             %% Ignore empty slices.
 3744:             ckf_await(Refs);
 3745:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, Collisions} ->
 3746:             [Collisions | ckf_await(Refs)]
 3747:     end;
 3748: ckf_await([]) ->
 3749:     [].
 3750: 
 3751: ckf_finder(Start, End, Mask, Keys) ->
 3752:     [ckf_finder_1(Start, End, Mask, Key) || Key <- Keys].
 3753: 
 3754: ckf_finder_1(Start, End, Mask, Key) ->
 3755:     true = Key >= Start, true = Key < End,      %Assertion.
 3756:     Target = internal_hash(Key) band Mask,
 3757:     ckf_finder_2(Start, End, Mask, Target, []).
 3758: 
 3759: ckf_finder_2(Same, Same, _Mask, _Target, [_]) ->
 3760:     %% Key collided with itself, ignore it.
 3761:     [];
 3762: ckf_finder_2(Same, Same, _Mask, _Target, Acc) ->
 3763:     Acc;
 3764: ckf_finder_2(Next, End, Mask, Target, Acc) ->
 3765:     case (internal_hash(Next) band Mask) =:= Target of
 3766:         true -> ckf_finder_2(Next + 1, End, Mask, Target, [Next | Acc]);
 3767:         false -> ckf_finder_2(Next + 1, End, Mask, Target, Acc)
 3768:     end.
 3769: 
 3770: internal_hash(Term) ->
 3771:     erts_debug:get_internal_state({internal_hash, Term}).
 3772:

 3850: 
 3851: %% This test case checks that the bug with ticket number OTP-15707 is
 3852: %% fixed. The bug could cause a crash or memory usage to grow until
 3853: %% the machine ran out of memory.
 3854: t_large_unequal_bins_same_hash_bug(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3855:     run_when_enough_resources(
 3856:       fun() ->
 3857:               K1 = get_4GB_bin(1),
 3858:               K2 = get_4GB_bin(2),
 3859:               Map = make_map(500),
 3860:               Map2 = maps:put(K1, 42, Map),
 3861:               %% The map needed to contain at least 32 key-value pairs
 3862:               %% at this point to get the crash or out of memory
 3863:               %% problem on the next line
 3864:               Map3 = maps:put(K2, 43, Map2),
 3865:               %% The following line should avoid that the compiler
 3866:               %% optimizes away the above
 3867:               io:format("~p ~p~n", [erlang:phash2(Map3), maps:size(Map3)])
 3868:       end).
 3869: 
 3870: 
 3871: 
 3872: make_map(0) -> 
 3873:     #{};
 3874: make_map(Size) ->
 3875:     maps:put(Size, Size, make_map(Size-1)).
 3876: 
 3877: get_4GB_bin(Value) ->
 3878:     List = lists:duplicate(65536, Value),
 3879:     Bin = erlang:iolist_to_binary(List),
 3880:     IOList4GB = duplicate_iolist(Bin, 16),
 3881:     Bin4GB = erlang:iolist_to_binary(IOList4GB),
 3882:     4294967296 = size(Bin4GB),
 3883:     Bin4GB.
 3884: 
 3885: duplicate_iolist(IOList, 0) ->
 3886:     IOList;
 3887: duplicate_iolist(IOList, NrOfTimes) ->
 3888:     duplicate_iolist([IOList, IOList], NrOfTimes - 1).
 3889: 
 3890: run_when_enough_resources(Fun) ->
 3891:     case {total_memory(), erlang:system_info(wordsize)} of
 3892:         {Mem, 8} when is_integer(Mem) andalso Mem >= 31 ->
 3893:             Fun();
 3894:         {Mem, WordSize} ->
 3895:             {skipped, 
 3896:              io_lib:format("Not enough resources (System Memory >= ~p, Word Size = ~p)",
 3897:                            [Mem, WordSize])}
 3898:     end.
 3899: 
 3900: total_memory() ->
 3901:     %% Total memory in GB.
 3902:     try
 3903: 	SMD = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
 3904:         TM = proplists:get_value(
 3905:                available_memory, SMD,
 3906:                proplists:get_value(
 3907:                  total_memory, SMD,
 3908:                  proplists:get_value(
 3909:                    system_total_memory, SMD))),
 3910:         TM div (1024*1024*1024)
 3911:     catch
 3912: 	_ : _ ->
 3913: 	    undefined
 3914:     end.
 3915: 
 3916: %% This test case checks that maps larger than 32 elements are readable
 3917: %% when displayed.
 3918: t_map_display(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3919:     verify_map_term(make_nontrivial_map(33)),
 3920:     verify_map_term(make_nontrivial_map(253)),
 3921:     verify_map_term({a, make_nontrivial_map(77)}),
 3922:     verify_map_term([make_nontrivial_map(42),
 3923:                      {a,make_nontrivial_map(99)},
 3924:                      make_nontrivial_map(77)]),
 3925: 
 3926:     ok.
 3927: 
 3928: make_nontrivial_map(N) ->
 3929:     make_nontrivial_map(N, 32).
 3930: 
 3931: make_nontrivial_map(N, Effort) ->
 3932:     L = [begin
 3933:              Key = case I rem 64 of
 3934:                        33 when Effort > 16 ->
 3935:                            make_nontrivial_map(I, Effort div 2);
 3936:                        _ ->
 3937:                            I
 3938:                    end,
 3939:              Value = case I rem 5 of
 3940:                          0 ->
 3941:                              I * I;
 3942:                          1 ->
 3943:                              if
 3944:                                  Effort > 16 ->
 3945:                                      make_nontrivial_map(33, Effort div 2);
 3946:                                  true ->
 3947:                                      make_map(Effort)
 3948:                              end;
 3949:                          2 ->
 3950:                              lists:seq(0, I rem 16);
 3951:                          3 ->
 3952:                              list_to_tuple(lists:seq(0, I rem 16));
 3953:                          4 ->
 3954:                              float(I)
 3955:                      end,
 3956:              {Key, Value}
 3957:          end || I <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 3958:     maps:from_list(L).
 3959: 
 3960: verify_map_term(Term) ->
 3961:     Printed = string:chomp(erts_internal:term_to_string(Term)),
 3962:     {ok,Tokens,1} = erl_scan:string(Printed ++ "."),
 3963:     {ok,ParsedTerm} = erl_parse:parse_term(Tokens),
 3964: 
 3965:     case ParsedTerm of
 3966:         Term ->
 3967:             ok;
 3968:         Other ->
 3969:             io:format("Expected:\n~p\n", [Term]),
 3970:             io:format("Got:\n~p", [Other]),
 3971:             ct:fail(failed)
 3972:     end.
 3973: 
 3974: %%%
 3975: %%% Benchmarks
 3976: %%%
 3977: 
 3978: -define(SMALL_MAP_SIZE, 32).
 3979: -define(BIG_MAP_SIZE, 3333).
 3980: 
 3981: benchmarks(_Config) ->
 3982:     N = 5000000,
 3983: 
 3984:     %% Looks up a known value in a flatmap and (relatively large) hashmap,
 3985:     %% the value will be near the middle of the tested flatmap in an
 3986:     %% attempt to make the test more representative.
 3987:     lookup_literal_immed_small(N),
 3988:     lookup_literal_immed_big(N),
 3989: 
 3990:     %% Looks up a value that _COULD_ be an immediate (and always is in this
 3991:     %% test), benchmarking the common case of looking up an unknown integer
 3992:     %% or similar.
 3993:     %%
 3994:     %% Like literal_immed_small, we try to pick a value that will be in the
 3995:     %% middle of the tested flatmap.
 3996:     lookup_any_immed_small(N),
 3997:     lookup_any_immed_big(N),
 3998: 
 3999:     %% Looks up `[{}]`, looking for regressions in pre-hashed complex
 4000:     %% lookups.
 4001:     lookup_literal_complex_small(N),
 4002:     lookup_literal_complex_big(N),
 4003: 
 4004:     %% Looks up some unknown complex term, looking for regressions in complex
 4005:     %% lookups that need to be hashed in runtime. 
 4006:     lookup_any_complex_small(N),
 4007:     lookup_any_complex_big(N),
 4008: 
 4009:     %% Looks up a bunch of keys in parallel, benchmarking maps-as-structs.
 4010:     lookup_literal_multi_small(N),
 4011:     lookup_literal_multi_big(N),
 4012: 
 4013:     ok.
 4014: 
 4015: lookup_literal_immed_small(Iterations) ->
 4016:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), []),
 4017:     F = fun(N) -> literal_immed(N, Map0, []) end,
 4018:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4019: 
 4020: lookup_literal_immed_big(Iterations) ->
 4021:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), []),
 4022:     F = fun(N) -> literal_immed(N, Map0, []) end,
 4023:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4024: 
 4025: literal_immed(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 4026:     Acc;
 4027: literal_immed(N, Map, _) ->
 4028:     #{ (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2) := Acc } = Map,
 4029:     literal_immed(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 4030: 
 4031: lookup_any_immed_small(Iterations) ->
 4032:     Size = ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1,
 4033:     Map = maps:from_list([{V, -V} || V <- lists:seq(-Size, Size)]),
 4034:     F = fun(N) -> any_immed(N, Map, Size div 2) end,
 4035:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4036: 
 4037: lookup_any_immed_big(Iterations) ->
 4038:     Size = ?BIG_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1,
 4039:     Map = maps:from_list([{V, -V} || V <- lists:seq(-Size, Size)]),
 4040:     F = fun(N) -> any_immed(N, Map, Size div 2) end,
 4041:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4042: 
 4043: any_immed(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 4044:     Acc;
 4045: any_immed(N, Map, Acc0) ->
 4046:     #{ Acc0 := Acc } = Map,
 4047:     any_immed(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 4048: 
 4049: lookup_literal_complex_small(Iterations) ->
 4050:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), []),
 4051:     F = fun(N) -> literal_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => [{}] }, [{}]) end,
 4052:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4053: 
 4054: lookup_literal_complex_big(Iterations) ->
 4055:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), []),
 4056:     F = fun(N) -> literal_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => [{}] }, [{}]) end,
 4057:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4058: 
 4059: literal_complex(0, Map, Acc) ->
 4060:     {Map, Acc};
 4061: literal_complex(N, Map, _) ->
 4062:     #{ [{}] := Acc } = Map,
 4063:     literal_complex(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 4064: 
 4065: lookup_any_complex_small(Iterations) ->
 4066:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE - 2), []),
 4067:     F = fun(N) ->
 4068:                 any_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => {[]}, {[]} => [{}] }, [{}])
 4069:         end,
 4070:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4071: 
 4072: lookup_any_complex_big(Iterations) ->
 4073:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE - 2), []),
 4074:     F = fun(N) ->
 4075:                 any_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => {[]}, {[]} => [{}] }, [{}])
 4076:         end,
 4077:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4078: 
 4079: any_complex(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 4080:     Acc;
 4081: any_complex(N, Map, Acc0) ->
 4082:     #{ Acc0 := Acc } = Map,
 4083:     any_complex(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 4084: 
 4085: lookup_literal_multi_small(Iterations) ->
 4086:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), id([])),
 4087:     F = fun(N) -> literal_multi(N, Map0, []) end,
 4088:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4089: 
 4090: lookup_literal_multi_big(Iterations) ->
 4091:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), id([])),
 4092:     F = fun(N) -> literal_multi(N, Map0, []) end,
 4093:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 4094: 
 4095: literal_multi(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 4096:     Acc;
 4097: literal_multi(N, Map, _) ->
 4098:     #{ (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 0) := Same,
 4099:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 1) := Same,
 4100:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1) := Same,
 4101:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 2) := Same,
 4102:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 2) := Same } = Map,
 4103:     literal_multi(N - 1, Map, Same).
 4104: 
 4105: time(Name, F, Iterations) ->
 4106:     Time = element(1, timer:tc(F, [Iterations])),
 4107:     ct_event:notify(#event{name=benchmark_data,
 4108:                            data=[{value, Time},
 4109:                                  {suite, ?MODULE_STRING},
 4110:                                  {name, atom_to_list(Name)}]}),
 4111:     Time.
